subject: RE: [junit] Issue tracker?
msgSnippet: Yeah, I wouldn t consider anything but JIRA.
messageBody:
Yeah, I wouldn't consider anything but JIRA.


> -----Original Message-----
> From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On
> Behalf Of David Saff
> Sent: Thursday, February 12, 2009 7:20 AM
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: Re: [junit] Issue tracker?
>
> I had forgotten that there might be free JIRA hosting
> available. Excellent idea.
>
> David Saff
>
> On Thu, Feb 12, 2009 at 7:20 AM, James Abley
> <james.abley@...> wrote:
>
> > 2009/2/11 David Saff <david@...>:
> > > OK, we've moved JUnit hosting to github. Next up is issue
> tracking.
> > > Any favorites out there? Easy URLs are a big win for me (
> > > http://somesite.com/junit/bugs/119989 or some such). Thanks,
> > >
> > > David Saff
> > >
> >
> > I'm quite a big fan of JIRA. Codehaus might be an option for the
> > hosting, or you could speak to someone at Atlassian. I
> understand that
> > they make their software available in some form for open-source
> > projects. I'd suggest test driving at Codehaus [2] or Apache [3] to
> > see if you like the interface.
> >
> > I've also used Launchpad and Trac, but JIRA is my favourite
> of those three.
> >
> > Cheers,
> >
> > James
> >
> > [1] http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/
> > [2] http://jira.codehaus.org
> > [3] http://issues.apache.org/jira/
> >
> >
> > ------------------------------------
> >
> > Yahoo! Groups Links
> >
> >
> >
> >
>
>
> [Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
>
>
>
